what: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: Retrieve datasets World Data (OWID) Chart API. OWID provides public access 5,000 data sets focusing large global problems poverty, disease, hunger, climate change, war, existential risks, inequality. ❗ Note: ETL Catalog API currently beta relies internal APIs change regular basis. API stable, also included package.

title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: can install development version owidapi GitHub :

title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: Load package: Download full life expectancy dataset: Get life expectancy data Australia, Austria, Germany: Download US life expectancy data 1970 1980: Get daily COVID-19 vaccination doses per capita Germany 2020-12-28 2020-12-31: Download data directly using URL: can get metadata list either provoding data set name URL. difference originalChartUrl value: want fetch full catalog available charts: search keywords catalog, can use following helper:
code: library(owidapi) owid_get("life-expectancy") #> # A tibble: 21,565 × 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 Afghanistan AFG        1950                                28.2 #>  2 Afghanistan AFG        1951                                28.6 #>  3 Afghanistan AFG        1952                                29.0 #>  4 Afghanistan AFG        1953                                29.5 #>  5 Afghanistan AFG        1954                                29.7 #>  6 Afghanistan AFG        1955                                30.4 #>  7 Afghanistan AFG        1956                                30.8 #>  8 Afghanistan AFG        1957                                31.3 #>  9 Afghanistan AFG        1958                                31.8 #> 10 Afghanistan AFG        1959                                32.3 #> # ℹ 21,555 more rows owid_get("life-expectancy", entities = c("AUS", "AUT", "GER")) #> # A tibble: 190 × 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 Australia   AUS        1885                                49.0 #>  2 Australia   AUS        1895                                53.0 #>  3 Australia   AUS        1905                                57   #>  4 Australia   AUS        1921                                61.0 #>  5 Australia   AUS        1922                                62.8 #>  6 Australia   AUS        1923                                61.7 #>  7 Australia   AUS        1924                                62.5 #>  8 Australia   AUS        1925                                63.2 #>  9 Australia   AUS        1926                                62.9 #> 10 Australia   AUS        1927                                62.8 #> # ℹ 180 more rows owid_get("life-expectancy", entities = "USA", start_date = 1970, end_date = 1980) #> # A tibble: 11 × 4 #>    entity_name   entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>         <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 United States USA        1970                                70.7 #>  2 United States USA        1971                                71.1 #>  3 United States USA        1972                                71.2 #>  4 United States USA        1973                                71.4 #>  5 United States USA        1974                                72.0 #>  6 United States USA        1975                                72.5 #>  7 United States USA        1976                                72.8 #>  8 United States USA        1977                                73.2 #>  9 United States USA        1978                                73.4 #> 10 United States USA        1979                                73.8 #> 11 United States USA        1980                                73.7 owid_get(   "daily-covid-vaccination-doses-per-capita",   entities = "DEU",   start_date = "2020-12-28",   end_date = "2020-12-31" ) #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   entity_name entity_id day        daily_vaccinations_smoothed_per_million #>   <chr>       <chr>     <chr>                                        <dbl> #> 1 Germany     DEU       2020-12-28                                  0.0215 #> 2 Germany     DEU       2020-12-29                                  0.0406 #> 3 Germany     DEU       2020-12-30                                  0.0525 #> 4 Germany     DEU       2020-12-31                                  0.0543 url <- paste0(   "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh",   "?tab=chart&time=earliest..2023&country=ARG~AUS~BWA~CHN~ALB~DEU" ) owid_get(url = url) #> # A tibble: 114 × 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year civil.liberties.score #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                 <int> #>  1 Albania     ALB        2005                    38 #>  2 Albania     ALB        2006                    38 #>  3 Albania     ALB        2007                    39 #>  4 Albania     ALB        2008                    40 #>  5 Albania     ALB        2009                    39 #>  6 Albania     ALB        2010                    40 #>  7 Albania     ALB        2011                    39 #>  8 Albania     ALB        2012                    39 #>  9 Albania     ALB        2013                    40 #> 10 Albania     ALB        2014                    40 #> # ℹ 104 more rows metadata <- owid_get_metadata("civil-liberties-score-fh") metadata_url <- owid_get_metadata(url = url) str(metadata) #> List of 3 #>  $ chart         :List of 5 #>   ..$ title           : chr "Civil liberties score" #>   ..$ subtitle        : chr "Based on the estimates and scoring by [Freedom House (2024)](#dod:freedom-house). It captures the extent of fre"| __truncated__ #>   ..$ citation        : chr "Freedom House (2024)" #>   ..$ originalChartUrl: chr "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh" #>   ..$ selection       :List of 4 #>   .. ..$ : chr "Argentina" #>   .. ..$ : chr "Australia" #>   .. ..$ : chr "Botswana" #>   .. ..$ : chr "China" #>  $ columns       :List of 1 #>   ..$ Civil liberties score:List of 14 #>   .. ..$ titleShort      : chr "Civil liberties score" #>   .. ..$ titleLong       : chr "Civil liberties score" #>   .. ..$ descriptionShort: chr "The variable identifies the fine-grained extent of freedom of expression and association, the rule of law, and "| __truncated__ #>   .. ..$ descriptionKey  : list() #>   .. ..$ unit            : chr "" #>   .. ..$ timespan        : chr "2005-2023" #>   .. ..$ type            : chr "Integer" #>   .. ..$ owidVariableId  : int 901305 #>   .. ..$ shortName       : chr "civlibs_score_fh" #>   .. ..$ lastUpdated     : chr "2024-05-16" #>   .. ..$ nextUpdate      : chr "2025-05-16" #>   .. ..$ citationShort   : chr "Freedom House (2024) – processed by Our World in Data" #>   .. ..$ citationLong    : chr "Freedom House (2024) – processed by Our World in Data. “Civil liberties score” [dataset]. Freedom House, “Freed"| __truncated__ #>   .. ..$ fullMetadata    : chr "https://api.ourworldindata.org/v1/indicators/901305.metadata.json" #>  $ dateDownloaded: chr "2025-02-25" all.equal(metadata, metadata_url) #> [1] "Length mismatch: comparison on first 3 components"                      #> [2] "Component \"chart\": Component \"originalChartUrl\": 1 string mismatch" catalog <- owid_get_catalog() catalog #> # A tibble: 5,012 × 18 #>       id slug     type  config created_at updated_at last_edited_at published_at #>    <int> <chr>    <chr> <chr>  <chr>      <chr>      <chr>          <chr>        #>  1  7968 militar… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-31 08… "2024-07-30… #>  2  7967 militar… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-30 12… ""           #>  3  7966 militar… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-30 12… ""           #>  4  7965 militar… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-31 08… "2024-07-30… #>  5  7964 militar… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-3… 2024-07-31 10… "2024-07-30… #>  6  7963 relativ… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-29 15… ""           #>  7  7962 tree-co… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-29 15… ""           #>  8  7961 hdi-lan… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-28 15… "2024-07-28… #>  9  7960 hdi-per… Scat… "{\"i… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-28 13… "2024-07-28… #> 10  7959 are-con… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-28 12… ""           #> # ℹ 5,002 more rows #> # ℹ 10 more variables: last_edited_by_user_id <int>, #> #   last_edited_by_user_id_label <chr>, published_by_user_id <int>, #> #   published_by_user_id_label <chr>, is_indexable <int>, title <chr>, #> #   subtitle <chr>, note <chr>, title_plus_variant <chr>, #> #   config_with_defaults <chr> owid_search(catalog, c("climate", "carbon")) #> # A tibble: 210 × 18 #>       id slug     type  config created_at updated_at last_edited_at published_at #>    <int> <chr>    <chr> <chr>  <chr>      <chr>      <chr>          <chr>        #>  1  7953 hdi-vs-… Line… "{\"i… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-28 13… "2024-07-26… #>  2  7947 low-car… Scat… "{\"i… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-22 10… "2024-07-22… #>  3  7943 tempera… Scat… "{\"i… 2024-07-1… 2024-07-1… 2024-07-19 08… ""           #>  4  7926 global-… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-1… 2024-07-19 09… "2024-07-03… #>  5  7925 spring-… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-05 08… "2024-07-03… #>  6  7924 autumn-… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-05 08… "2024-07-03… #>  7  7923 winter-… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-05 08… "2024-07-03… #>  8  7922 summer-… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-05 08… "2024-07-03… #>  9  7921 country… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-1… 2024-07-10 10… "2024-07-03… #> 10  7917 materia… Stac… "{\"i… 2024-07-0… 2024-07-2… 2024-07-24 11… "2024-07-14… #> # ℹ 200 more rows #> # ℹ 10 more variables: last_edited_by_user_id <int>, #> #   last_edited_by_user_id_label <chr>, published_by_user_id <int>, #> #   published_by_user_id_label <chr>, is_indexable <int>, title <chr>, #> # title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: owidR package broken since World Data updated API, received commit since November 2023, uses different dependencies (e.g., data.table, httr, rvest).

what: Download data from Our World in Data — owid_get
title: Download data from Our World in Data — owid_get
text: Retrieves datasets World Data (OWID) specifying dataset name direct URL. Allows filtering entities time periods.

title: Download data from Our World in Data — owid_get
code: owid_get(   data_set = NULL,   entities = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   url = NULL,   use_column_short_names = TRUE,   snake_case = TRUE )

title: Download data from Our World in Data — owid_get
text: data_set Character string specifying dataset download (e.g., "life-expectancy"). required url provided. entities Vector entity codes (e.g., c("USA", "DEU")). NULL, data available entities returned. start_date Start date filtering data. Can date string year. NULL, starts earliest available data. end_date End date filtering data. Can date string year. NULL, ends latest available data. url Direct URL OWID dataset. provided, data_set ignored. use_column_short_names Logical. TRUE (default), uses short column names. snake_case Logical. TRUE (default), converts column names lowercase.

title: Download data from Our World in Data — owid_get
text: tibble containing requested OWID data.

title: Download data from Our World in Data — owid_get
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Download a full table owid_get("life-expectancy")  # Download a table only for selected entities owid_get("life-expectancy", c("AUS", "AUT", "GER"))  # Download a table only for selected time periods owid_get("life-expectancy", c("USA"), 1970, 1980)  # Download daily data for selected time periods owid_get(  "daily-covid-vaccination-doses-per-capita", "DEU",  "2020-12-28", "2020-12-31" )  # Download a table by just providing an URL (with or without .csv) owid_get(  url = paste0(    "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh",    "?tab=chart&time=earliest..2023&country=ARG~AUS~BWA~CHN~ALB~DEU"  ) ) owid_get(  url = paste0(    "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh.csv",    "?tab=chart&time=earliest..2023"  ) ) }

what: Download data catalog of Our World in Data — owid_get_catalog
title: Download data catalog of Our World in Data — owid_get_catalog
text: Download data catalog World Data

title: Download data catalog of Our World in Data — owid_get_catalog
Download data catalog of Our World in Data — owid_get_catalog
text: snake_case Logical. TRUE (default), converts column names lowercase.

title: Download data catalog of Our World in Data — owid_get_catalog
text: tibble containing OWID catalog.

title: Download data catalog of Our World in Data — owid_get_catalog
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Download a full table owid_get_catalog() }

what: Download metadata from Our World in Data — owid_get_metadata
title: Download metadata from Our World in Data — owid_get_metadata
text: Retrieves metadata data set World Data (OWID) specifying dataset name direct URL.

title: Download metadata from Our World in Data — owid_get_metadata
Download metadata from Our World in Data — owid_get_metadata
text: data_set Character string specifying dataset download (e.g., "life-expectancy"). required url provided. url Direct URL OWID dataset. provided, data_set ignored.

title: Download metadata from Our World in Data — owid_get_metadata
text: list containing requested OWID metadata.

title: Download metadata from Our World in Data — owid_get_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Download metadata using a data set owid_get_metadata("life-expectancy")  # Download metadata using an url owid_get_metadata(  url = "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh" ) }

what: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data — owid_search
title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data — owid_search
text: function searches vector keywords within specified columns OWID catalog data frame tibble. columns specified, searches character factor columns.

title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data — owid_search
Search for keywords in OWID catalog data — owid_search
text: data data frame tibble, typically obtained owid_get_catalog. keywords character vector one keywords search . search case-insensitive. columns optional character vector column names search within. NULL (default), character factor columns searched.

title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data — owid_search
text: filtered data frame containing rows match least one keywords least one specified columns.

title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data — owid_search
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get the OWID catalog catalog <- owid_get_catalog()  # Search for climate or carbon in all text columns owid_search(catalog, c("climate", "carbon"))  # Search only in the title column owid_search(catalog, c("climate", "carbon"), c("title")) }
